title: Celestial Nocturne
subtitle: Runway gown embroidery program

thumbnail.alt: Dark textile with reflective embellishment under studio lighting

heroMedia.alt: Couture gown detail under dramatic atelier lighting

overview: A midnight silk silhouette animated by thousands of sequins, crystals, and thread gradients that shift like a constellation under runway light. This piece explored the idea of celestial cartography translated into couture embroidery.
challenge: Translate celestial references into embroidery that stayed fluid and lightweight enough for natural movement on the runway, while maintaining a sense of luminous depth.
approach: Mapped embellishment density in anatomical zones, balancing highlight points with breathable negative space. Developed a custom degrade technique graduating from dense crystal clusters to floating singular sequins.
outcome: Delivered final pieces across three fittings with zero rework in the final two rounds. The gown was selected for the seasonal presentation closing look.

title: Gilded Botanical
subtitle: Couture jacket capsule collection

thumbnail.alt: Textured gold embroidery close-up on couture jacket

heroMedia.alt: Tailored couture piece with ornate botanical embroidery

overview: A study in raised metallic flora layered across tailored couture jackets, using traditional goldwork techniques reimagined for a contemporary silhouette. Each motif referenced botanical illustrations from 18th-century herbariums.
challenge: Create significant relief and directional light play while preserving precise drape at shoulder and sleeve junctions — areas where heavy embroidery typically distorts garment architecture.
approach: Built a relief hierarchy using corded channels and selective padding for controlled projection. Each botanical element was engineered with varying stitch densities to ensure the jacket maintained its tailored line while the embroidery appeared richly three-dimensional.
outcome: The collection was featured in the seasonal showroom presentation and adopted as a repeat client custom request, with three additional jacket commissions placed in the following quarter.

title: Porcelain Garden
subtitle: Bridal couture ensemble

thumbnail.alt: Soft floral embroidery with pearl details on bridal fabric

heroMedia.alt: Bridal couture look with ornate handcrafted floral details

overview: Hand-layered pearl and floral compositions inspired by antique porcelain painting, translated into a full bridal ensemble. The project demanded extraordinary softness and lightness despite extensive surface coverage.
challenge: Maintain visual softness and bridal delicacy while coordinating multiple artisan teams across two ateliers to meet a compressed delivery milestone for a destination wedding.
approach: Defined technique ownership by panel and introduced color-calibrated sample cards to ensure tonal consistency across different artisans working independently. Applied pearls in graduated density patterns inspired by ceramic glaze pooling.
outcome: Completed full ensemble set ahead of deadline with consistent stitch language across all garment sections — bodice, veil, train, and removable cape.

title: Shadow Lattice
subtitle: Evening wear collection embroidery

thumbnail.alt: Geometric embroidery pattern with transparent cutwork detail

heroMedia.alt: Evening dress with geometric architectural embroidery

overview: An exploration of architectural geometry through controlled cutwork and structural embroidery, creating pieces that revealed skin as a design element through precise lattice patterns.
challenge: Engineer cutwork embroidery that maintained structural integrity under movement while creating controlled transparency that would photograph well under varied lighting conditions.
approach: Developed a reinforcement grid system using corded couching as an invisible skeleton, allowing aggressive cutwork without compromising garment stability. Each lattice module was tested for stretch tolerance before final application.
outcome: Six-piece collection delivered on schedule with all pieces passing movement testing on the runway. Featured in three international fashion publications.

title: Vermillion Thread
subtitle: Red carpet commission

thumbnail.alt: Rich red threadwork embroidery with tonal gradient

heroMedia.alt: Custom red carpet gown with elaborate thread gradient embroidery

overview: A monochromatic exploration of red — from deepest oxblood to luminous vermillion — using thread density and direction to create a painterly gradient across a full-length gown for a major film premiere.
challenge: Create a seamless tonal gradient across 3 metres of fabric using only thread, without visible seam lines or density breaks that would appear in high-resolution photography.
approach: Developed a 14-shade thread palette and mapped each zone to specific density values. Artisans worked panel-by-panel using calibrated reference boards to ensure gradient continuity across joins.
outcome: The gown was worn at the Venice Film Festival and subsequently featured in Vogue Italia's couture craft editorial.

title: Ivory Architecture
subtitle: Couture show finale piece

thumbnail.alt: Dimensional white embroidery with architectural relief patterns

heroMedia.alt: Finale couture piece with sculptural ivory embroidery

overview: An architectural embroidery study in monochrome ivory, creating dramatic dimensional effects through padding, relief, and controlled shadow. Designed as the closing look for a Paris Couture Week presentation.
challenge: Achieve maximum visual drama through texture alone — without colour, metallic, or bead elements — while keeping the garment light enough for a model to wear comfortably through a full runway walk.
approach: Engineered a layered padding system using graduated felt underlays and directional stitching to create shadow effects that animated the surface under changing light. Reduced weight by 35% by replacing traditional padding with architectural foam cores.
outcome: Selected as the show finale look. The technique was subsequently developed into a standalone workshop module for training junior artisans.
